result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew E Crawford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Designer Drugs(>10-50g), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(hm)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Credit for 12 days granted.
Consecutive to: current sentence

superMiscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid from Prison wages and as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.

records.addlTxt: filed, to be produced from Milwaukee House of Corrections
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 30, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court.  Defendant Andrew E Crawford did not appear.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ertl advises defendant is in custody at Milwaukee House of Corrections.  Attorney Ertl to advise the Court by November 17, 2017 if the Court needs to prepare an order to produce.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 30, 2017 at 02:00 pm.  Check Case scheduled for November 17, 2017.
Sentencing hearing on November 10, 2017 at 10:30 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Andrew E Crawford in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Court conducts plea colloquy with defendant.  Defense requests pre-sentence investigation.  Court orders.  Attorney Ertl to notify clerk if defendant needs to be produced for the next hearing.  

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2017 at 10:30 am.
Order denying defendant's motion to suppress

Defendant Andrew E Crawford in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for defendant's Motion to Challenge the Stop.  

Officer James Ament of the City of New Berlin Police Department sworn in and gives testimony on behalf of the State.  Cross-examination by Attorney Ertl.  State rests.  
Sergeant Kevin Turner of the City of New Berlin Police Department sworn in and gives testimony on behalf of the defense.  Defense rests.  Court closes evidentiary portion of the hearing.

State makes arguments.  Defense makes arguments.  Court denies defendant's motion to suppress.  Next court dates remain as set.
to Dismiss/Suppress Illegal Stop filed by Atty Ertl.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
Jury trial - 12 person on September 19, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on September 14, 2017 at 09:30 am.
Motion hearing on July 19, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Trial Scheduling Order

Defendant Andrew E Crawford in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Dominic Busalacchi, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ertl advises he will be filing a motion to challenge the stop and requests motion date.  Court sets.  Attorney Ertl to file motion no later than July 8, 2017.  State to notify Court within one week of any witness conflicts.   
Court also places case on the trial calendar.  Court to issue trial scheduling order.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 19, 2017 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 19, 2017 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for September 14, 2017 at 09:30 am.  Check Case scheduled for July 6, 2017.
Hearing on June 29, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Andrew E Crawford in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense recently received offer and requests brief adjournment to review with defendant.  Court grants short adjournment.  Hearing scheduled for June 29, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Based upon the WCS Report from 5/3/17, the Court modifies the bond to remove WCS reporting requirements due to the Defendant relocating to another county.  Should the Defendant move back to Waukesha County during the pendency of the case, he shall notify the Court and the Court will require him to participate in the WCS Pretrial monitoring program.
5/3/17 Letter from WCS advising Defendant reported as ordered
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 16, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Andrew E Crawford in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests adjournment to continue negotiations with State.  Defendant has moved out of county and requests to be released from WCS monitoring.  State objects.  Court orders defendant to report to WCS after today's hearing to test.  WCS to provide Court with test results.  If case does not resolve by next hearing, matter will be placed on the trial calendar.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 16, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
